tier_2_material.motive_for_crime: Financial dispute and revenge, as the accused had previously borrowed money from the deceased and was unable to repay it, leading to the deceased taking the accused's wristwatch as repayment.

tier_3_contextual.place_of_offense: Office of Social Forestry at Gargoti, situated on the first floor of Ganesh Bhuvan building.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Anant Chandru Wake vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.judges_coram: S.S. Parkar & Anoop V. Mohta, JJ.
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Mr. S.V. Marwadi with Mr. A.P. Mundargi
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code Sections 302, 392 read with 397

residual_details.additional_facts: The accused was previously employed in the office of Social Forestry where the crime took place. The deceased was the Ranger Forest Officer, Mangesh Sawant, who was murdered, and his gold chain, ring, and cash were stolen. The accused was seen in the vicinity on the evening of the murder. The conviction was based on circumstantial evidence, including the recovery of stolen items and blood-stained clothes from the accused. Accused No. 2, a clerk in the office, was acquitted.
